section.title: Information On CGI parameters
section.para: The menu on the left side of the classical web interface contains entries which offer a quick way to the information most people need. However you can change the parameters or use other options as well. Some CGIs require an objecttype ("host", "hostgroup", "service", or "servicegroup"), often followed by one or more options. The best way is to take a look at the existing URLs and change them according to your needs.
Below you will find a table showing the parameters and the CGIs they apply to. The names of the CGIs are abbreviated. An explanation along with a hint to the source code can be found here.
Following this table is an explanation of the parameters (work in progress).
Further information regarding the several parameters is given below. For a detailed understanding please have a look at the source code.

row.entry: The command will affects host and its services
How many archive log files will be searched to determine the initial states
Please keep in mind that processing of the files may take a while
Send notification to all contacts (non-escalated and escalated)
0=doesn't affect child hosts; 1=schedule triggered downtime; 2=schedule non-triggered downtime
May depend on the setting of "lock_author_names" in cgi.cfg
A valid contact as mail recipient
Specify whether or not the report output should be in csv format
This option automatically sets "noheader". Added to nearly all CGIs (see note [2])
1=recent alerts; 2=alert totals; 3=top alerts; 4=hostgroup alert totals; 5=host alert totals; 6=service alert totals; 7=servicegroup alert totals
Omit some HTML code and SSI header/footer
End time of the fixed downtime
Whether or not the downtime will be fixed
The service check will be forced
Send notification regardless of restrictions (timeperiods or else)
Which objects should be graphed in what state
A boolean OR of: 1=Host up; 2=Host down; 4=Host unreachable; 8=Service OK; 16=Service Warning; 32=Service Unknown; 64=Service Critical
Select all hosts or a specific host whose services should be displayed
special characters in the name have to be urlencoded (i.e. "%20" instead of a blank)
Select all hostgroups or one specific hostgroup whose hosts and services should be displayed
special characters in the name have to be urlencoded (i.e. "%20" instead of a blank)
Select the hosts (including the services) matching the given bit pattern. Note that the hosts have to match ALL conditions specified
A boolean OR of the states specified in include/cgiutils.c [1] (HOST AND SERVICE FILTER PROPERTIES)
The state the hosts should be in
A boolean OR of the states: 1=DOWN; 2=UNREACHABLE; 4=UP
The state the host should be in
A boolean OR of the states: 1=Pending; 2=Up; 4=Down; 8=Unreachable
Duration of the flexible downtime in full hours (see minutes)
Only valid if defining a flexible downtime
Specify whether or not the report output should be in json format
This option automatically sets "noheader". Added to nearly all CGIs (see note [2])
Duration of the flexible downtime (see hours)
Omit global status information and only show status details
Default: show most recent entries first
The string sent as the performance data
The comment will be persistent if this option is set
The string sent as the plugin output
The length is limited by the value of MAX_INPUT_LENGTH (set during compile time)
Specify the state the plugin should have
The command will be propagated to child hosts
Specify a timeperiod which is used for the availability report
Use the short name from the timeperiod definition
Delay command scheduling by n minutes
Send a notification for the acknowledgement
Select all services or a specific service which should be displayed
Special characters in the name have to be urlencoded (i.e. "%20" instead of a blank)
Select only services matching the given pattern
The pattern is case sensitive. Regular expressions seem to work
Select all servicegroup or one specific servicegroup whose hosts and services should be displayed
Special characters in the name have to be urlencoded (i.e. "%20" instead of a blank)
Select the services matching the given bit pattern. Note that the services have to match ALL conditions specified
A boolean OR of the states specified in include/cgiutils.c [1] (HOST AND SERVICE FILTER PROPERTIES)
State the services should be in
A boolean OR of the states: 8=Warning; 16=Unknown; 32=Critical; 64=OK
State the services should be in
A boolean OR of the states: 1=Pending; 2=OK, 4=Warning; 8=Unknown; 16=Critical
Importance of services in relation to hosts
Services are 1/n important as hosts. Default: n=4
Specify the column to sort on
Specify the sort order on the column specified by "sortoption=<n>"
1=recent alerts; 2=recent host alerts; 3=recent service alerts; 4=top host alert producers; 5=top service alert producers
Format "MM-DD-YYYY HH:MI" (may depend on your local settings, but unsure about that)
Specify the information to be shown
only applies to objecttypes "hostgroups" and "servicegroups";hostdetail=host status details; detail=service status details; summary=status summary; grid=status grid;
Start point of a custom timeperiod
End point of a custom timeperiod
Timeperiod which should be used for the availability report
today; yesterday; thisweek; lastweek; thismonth; lastmonth; thisquarter; lastquarter; thisyear; lastyear; last24hours; last7days; last31days; custom
The downtime will be triggered by downtime id <n>
hosts; hostgroups; services; servicegroups; contacts; contactgroups; timeperiods; commands; hostescalations; serviceescalations; hostdependencies; servicedependencies

section.para: Abbreviations used in the first table, relations to CGI and menu items, and links to the source code in <icinga-core>/cgis.

row.entry: Comments, Downtime, Process Info, Performance Info, Schedulung Info
Hostgroup Overview, Servicegroup Overview, Host Problems, Service Problems

section.para: [1] Logical OR means that the numbers are added and only the objects will be displayed satisfying ALL conditions.

[3] avail, log, notif, out, status, sum: all views/reports support jsonoutput; config: all types except command expansion; ext: all views except hostgroup/servicegroup info (always without performance data); tac: data output in json format. More details in the &name-icinga; wiki.
